content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

Here is how your function should work:
```julia
using TimeZones, Dates 

dt = now() # returns a DateTime type
bump_default(dt)    #> 2017-04-30T22:59:51.685

bump_to_plus_three(dt)   #> 2017-04-30T22:59:51.685
```

### Hints
* [Dates](https://docs.julialang.org/en/latest/stdlib/Dates/) and [TimeZones](https://github.com/MikeInnes/TimeZones.jl) have their own tutorials which should help you out.
